ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I personally don't like statistics, but I found the course useful for anyone that wants to gain these skills. I definitely had to learn a lot and felt that I did so, even if at times it was frustrating for me.
It is a "non-mathy" introduction to statistics. I would recommend this to anyone who wants to learn how to read basic regression tables, and how to use STATA.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I do think it has deepened my knowledge of sociology. Certainly the divide between quantitative and qualitative research isn't so deep--I think it's just a matter of shifting thinking and being flexible enough to still see the sociology in a more numbers-based approach. I likely won't be doing any statistical analysis in my own dissertation research, but I appreciate learning these skills.
I knew very little of stats prior to entering this class. I still know very little, but I know a lot more than I did. It will certainly help me with my research.
